alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 1:48AM EST until January 26 at 5:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk and Southeast Suffolk Counties. * WHEN...Until 5 AM EST early this morning. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect around 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 8 to 12 ft along the oceanfront will result in beach erosion and flooding. Scattered areas of dune base erosion are expected, but washovers are not expected. Breaking waves of 2 to 4 ft will result in beach erosion and splashover with minor damage possible to waterfront structures around Orient Point. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.6 FT, MODERATE 6.3 FT, MAJOR 7.1 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.2 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 26/04 AM 5.5/ 6.0 2.1/ 2.6 2.2/ 2.7 1-2 MINOR 26/04 PM 2.2/ 2.7 -1.1/-0.7 -0.7/-0.2 1 NONE 27/05 AM 2.5/ 3.0 -1.0/-0.5 -0.9/-0.4 1 NONE 27/05 PM 2.2/ 2.7 -1.1/-0.7 -0.5/ 0.0 0 NONE 28/05 AM 3.0/ 3.5 -0.5/ 0.0 -0.5/ 0.0 1 NONE 28/05 PM 2.2/ 2.7 -1.3/-0.8 -0.3/ 0.2 1 NONE ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
